body:
## What's Changed

* Accept unknown perlcritic violations & use severity from perlcritic report  (#139) @otrosien
* Refine new CPD (Copy-Paste Detection) report (#138) @otrosien
**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/sonar-perl/sonar-perl/compare/0.5.5...v0.5.6

## What's Changed

* docker push on master & tags (#137) @otrosien
* Release via github (#136) @otrosien
* Publish sonar report (#135) @otrosien
* build in github (#134) @otrosien
* CPD Analyzer (rework) (#132) @otrosien
**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/sonar-perl/sonar-perl/compare/0.5.4...v0.5.5

## What's Changed

* Sonar 8.9 compatibility (LTS) by @otrosien in https://github.com/sonar-perl/sonar-perl/pull/128


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/sonar-perl/sonar-perl/compare/0.5.3...0.5.4

Release 0.5.3

- Get sonar-clover-plugin from Sonatype public repo (#121) (contribution by @amottier)
- Compile for Java 8 using Java 11 (#119) (contribution by @amottier)
- Allow nesting of POD and Heredoc (#115)

Release 0.5.2

* SonarQube 7.9+ support
* internal dependencies updates
* Skip files when parsing/reading errors occur #104 (contribution by @alepulver)
* Update documentation for SonarQube 7.3+ #101 (contribution by @jtk18)

FYI: Releases 0.4.7 to 0.5.0 did not publish their artifacts back to github, so I removed them.

Release 0.4.6

* Fix multiline heredoc strings (#93 #98)
* Update the perlcritic rule catalog (#97)

Release 0.4.5

* Fix parsing of heredoc delimiter in an if-condition context
* Fix start-up warning about file extention being multi-valued

Release 0.4.4

* Parser support for raw regex patterns like $a =~ /^.*/
* Parser support for backticks
* Parser support for heredocs
* Switched the packaging from sonar-packaging plugin to shadowJar
* Library upgrades (commons-compress, yamlbeans)
* Gradle build improvements

Release 0.4.3

* Proper support for quote-like operators (qq{}, s/// etc)

Release 0.4.2

* Fixed highlighting of test code
* Code clean up

Release 0.4.0

* Dropped support for SonarQube 5.6
* Added support for SonarQube 7.6+ and 7.0+
* New code highlighting based on SSLR parser

Release 0.3.2

* Support for SonarQube 6.4+ (except for Code Colorization)

Release 0.3.1

* Update project on docker hub. use new "sonarperl/sonar-perl" repo (#53)  
* Upgrade dependencies
* Move package namespace (com.github.otrosien.perl -> com.github.sonarperl) (#50)
* Remove dependency on guava

***This version does not support SonarQube 6.4 yet!***

Release 0.3.0

* experimentally support JUnit for TAP reporting (#49) [contribution by @stphnlyd]

Release 0.2.10
- Added simplistic remediation cost for technical debt (linear: 5min per issue)

Release 0.2.9
- Support different compression and archive formats. (Issue #36) 
- Fix: Set correct file encoding on opening
- Resilience against non-TAP content in test report

Release 0.2.8
- Added successul and failed test metric

Release 0.2.7
- Added import of test duration metrics

Release 0.2.6
- Added integration tests with SonarQube 6.1
- Added lots of unit tests
- Made Perl::Critic scanner fail-safe against unknown rules. (Issue #24)

Release 0.2.5
- Added tags and rule types to perlcritic issues

Release 0.2.4
- Fixed and stabilized parsing of perlcritic_report.txt file
- Extended registry of Perl::Critic rules.

Release 0.2.3
- Added basic structural metrics: Classes, Functions

Release 0.2.2
- Fixed regular expression for comment lines

## Release 0.2.1
- New metric: Comment lines

# Release 0.2.0
- Upgraded to SonarQube 5.6 APIs
- Switched to alpine base docker image
- Provided docker-compose.yml for easier setup
- Added a lot of documentation
- Provided pre-built docker images on docker hub (https://hub.docker.com/r/otrosien/sonar-perl/)
- Provided binary releases on github
Release 0.1.8
Release 0.1.7
Release 0.1.6
Release 0.1.5
